full_text: In this demo, I'll do a policy change transaction that will result in a change to the premium and taxes. For the purposes of this demo, I will add an additional vehicle to a personal auto policy. To start the policy change, click Actions. Click Change Policy. The next step is to enter a description for this policy change. Click the Description field. Type, Adding Vehicle into the field. Click Next to move to the next step in the Policy Change wizard. Click Vehicles to jump directly to that step of the wizard. Click the Create Vehicle button. Click the VIN field. Type 3 in the field. Click the License State field. Select California. Click the Cost New field. Type 19,000. Click the Add button. Click Ray Newton. Nothing else needs to be changed, so click Quote. This is the Quote screen for the policy change. Because a new vehicle was added to this policy. Because a new vehicle was added to this policy, the cost has increased by $640. Next, we'll look at the Cost Change Detail to get more information about what changed. Click Cost Change Detail. This tab shows specifically what costs changed during this transaction. There is additional premium and taxes. Keep in mind that this change was very simple. However, this can become more complex if there were more vehicles and changes were made to those vehicles. The next step is to issue the policy. Click the Issue Policy button. Click OK to confirm. Click the Policy link. Click Financial Transactions. This is the Financial Transactions screen. This screen has three ways to view the transactions. First is just all transactions. Next is to view the transactions by job. And finally, to view the transactions by period. Click on Transactions by Period. This is the Transactions by Period screen. Click the View by Cost link. This is the Transactions by Cost screen. On this screen we can see the details about each cost. Notice that the first set is from the submission. After scrolling down the screen, it's now possible to see that the second set of costs are from the policy change. Next, we'll look at the Transactions by Job. Click the Return to Transactions by Period button. Click the Return to Financial Transactions button. Click the Transactions by Job link. This is the Transactions by Job screen. Notice that the first set is from the submission and the second set is from the policy change. This completes this demo.

segments.text: In this demo, I'll do a policy change transaction that will result in a change to the premium and taxes. For the purposes of this demo, I will add an additional vehicle to a personal auto policy.
To start the policy change, click Actions. Click Change Policy.
The next step is to enter a description for this policy change. Click the Description field. Type, Adding Vehicle into the field.
Click Next to move to the next step in the Policy Change wizard. Click Vehicles to jump directly to that step of the wizard. Click the Create Vehicle button. Click the VIN field.
Type 3 in the field. Click the License State field. Select California. Click the Cost New field. Type 19,000. Click the Add button. Click Ray Newton.
Nothing else needs to be changed, so click Quote. This is the Quote screen for the policy change.
Because a new vehicle was added to this policy. Because a new vehicle was added to this policy, the cost has increased by $640.
Next, we'll look at the Cost Change Detail to get more information about what changed.
Click Cost Change Detail.
This tab shows specifically what costs changed during this transaction.
There is additional premium and taxes. Keep in mind that this change was very simple.
However, this can become more complex if there were more vehicles and changes were made to those vehicles.
The next step is to issue the policy.
Click the Issue Policy button.
Click OK to confirm.
Click the Policy link.
Click Financial Transactions.
This is the Financial Transactions screen.
This screen has three ways to view the transactions.
First is just all transactions.
Next is to view the transactions by job.
And finally, to view the transactions by period.
Click on Transactions by Period.
This is the Transactions by Period screen.
Click the View by Cost link.
This is the Transactions by Cost screen.
On this screen we can see the details about each cost.
Notice that the first set is from the submission.
After scrolling down the screen, it's now possible to see that the second set of costs are from the policy change.
Next, we'll look at the Transactions by Job.
Click the Return to Transactions by Period button.
Click the Return to Financial Transactions button.
Click the Transactions by Job link.
This is the Transactions by Job screen.
Notice that the first set is from the submission and the second set is from the policy change.
This completes this demo.
